pullRequest.body:
We add the type `ContinuousAlgHom` for continuous algebra homomorphisms.

Co-authored-by:  Antoine Chambert-Loir <antoine.chambert-loir@u-paris.fr>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [2cf06ce174](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/12800/commits/2cf06ce17476b5b9a87dd02d204a0cb20d377aa2)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ContinuousAlgHom`
`+ Simps.apply`
`+ Simps.coe`
`+ _root_.DenseRange.topologicalClosure_map_subalgebra`
`+ _root_.Subalgebra.coe_valA`
`+ _root_.Subalgebra.coe_valA'`
`+ _root_.Subalgebra.topologicalClosure`
`+ _root_.Subalgebra.topologicalClosure_coe`
`+ _root_.Subalgebra.topologicalClosure_map`
`+ _root_.Subalgebra.valA`
`+ _root_.Subalgebra.valA_apply`
`+ _root_.Submodule.range_valA`
`+ codRestrict`
`+ coe_codRestrict`
`+ coe_codRestrict_apply`
`+ coe_coe`
`+ coe_comp`
`+ coe_comp'`
`+ coe_copy`
`+ coe_eq_id`
`+ coe_fst`
`+ coe_fst'`
`+ coe_id`
`+ coe_id'`
`+ coe_inj`
`+ coe_mk`
`+ coe_mk'`
`+ coe_mul`
`+ coe_pow`
`+ coe_prod`
`+ coe_prodMap`
`+ coe_prodMap'`
`+ coe_rangeRestrict`
`+ coe_restrictScalars`
`+ coe_restrictScalars'`
`+ coe_snd`
`+ coe_snd'`
`+ comp`
`+ comp_apply`
`+ comp_assoc`
`+ comp_id`
`+ continuous`
`+ copy`
`+ copy_eq`
`+ eqOn_adjoin_iff`
`+ eqOn_closure_adjoin`
`+ eqOn_sup`
`+ equalizer_eq_top`
`+ equalizer_same`
`+ equalizer_toSubmodule`
`+ ext`
`+ ext_iff`
`+ ext_on`
`+ ext_on_codisjoint`
`+ ext_ring`
`+ ext_ring_iff`
`+ fst`
`+ fst_comp_prod`
`+ fst_prod_snd`
`+ id`
`+ id_apply`
`+ id_comp`
`+ instance (s : Subalgebra R A) : TopologicalSemiring s`
`+ instance : AlgHomClass (A →A[R] B) R A B`
`+ instance : ContinuousMapClass (A →A[R] B) A B`
`+ instance : FunLike (A →A[R] B) A B`
`+ instance : Monoid (A →A[R] A)`
`+ instance : Mul (A →A[R] A) := ⟨comp⟩`
`+ instance : One (A →A[R] A) := ⟨ContinuousAlgHom.id R A⟩`
`+ instance [TopologicalSemiring A] [DiscreteTopology R] :`
`+ instance {D : Type*} [UniformSpace D] [CompleteSpace D]`
`+ le_equalizer`
`+ map_add`
`+ map_neg`
`+ map_smul`
`+ map_smul_of_tower`
`+ map_sub`
`+ map_sum`
`+ map_zero`
`+ mul_apply`
`+ mul_def`
`+ one_apply`
`+ one_def`
`+ prod`
`+ prodEquiv`
`+ prod_apply`
`+ rangeRestrict`
`+ restrictScalars`
`+ snd`
`+ snd_comp_prod`
`+ toAlgHomMonoidHom`
`+ toAlgHom_eq_coe`
`+ uniformContinuous`
`++ prodMap`
`- Subalgebra.topologicalClosure`
`- Subalgebra.topologicalClosure_coe`
`- Subalgebra.topologicalSemiring`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
It looks like there were a bunch of comments that never got addressed (probably because they were hidden in the fold). Can you address and resolve them please?
I'm surprised, I had the impression to have addressed all questions.
Now it should be OK, sorry.

You were right, it was appropriate to change from submodules to subalgebras.
Now, a new part of Subalgebra/Basic contains new material about `AlgHom.equalizer` that may deserve an independent PR (but that will be simpler if it can be avoided).
Moreover, I asked here
https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/AlgHom.2Eequalizer.20.2F.20LinearMap.2EeqLocus/near/454500957
if AlgHom.equalizer should be renamed AlgHom.eqLocus.

Looks so much nicer that it's phrased in terms of subalgebras now. Thanks! I appreciate the work on the `Subalgebra` API to get it across the line. The `AlgHomClass` usage is good, and as for renaming, that can always occur later if we want.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10134106831/job/28019976258)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10134106831/job/28019976334)
looking pretty good now. The main issue I see is that there is a bias towards submodules and linear maps instead of subalgebras and algebra homomorphisms. It's not clear to me why.

Thanks for doing this work! It can be boring and tedious, but it is valuable.

It would be nice to add a section about the relationship to `ContinuousLinearMap` via the coercion, although you'll need to add also a `ContinuousLinearMapClass` instance.
looking pretty good now. The main issue I see is that there is a bias towards submodules and linear maps instead of subalgebras and algebra homomorphisms. It's not clear to me why.

```suggestion
  map_mul f x y    := map_mul f.toAlgHom x y
  map_one f        := map_one f.toAlgHom
  map_add f        := map_add f.toAlgHom
  map_zero f       := map_zero f.toAlgHom
  commutes f r     := f.toAlgHom.commutes r
  map_continuous f := f.2
```

```suggestion
open Set TopologicalSpace Algebra BigOperators
```

```suggestion
Authors: Scott Morrison, Antoine Chambert-Loir, María Inés de Frutos-Fernández
```
I don't understand what is happening here

We did not add this, but looking at the [git blame](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/350879f78bdda0673c10fb75895e4492b226b3d2), it seems that `Submodule.continuousSMul` was superseded by
`SMulMemClass.continuousSMul` and this line is recording the new align.

```suggestion
section TopologicalAlgebra
```

Style comment here and throughout. I won't mark the other ones, but please find them.
```suggestion
necessary for the definition, although in applications `M` and `B` will be topological algebras
over the topological ring `R`. -/
```

I think we don't actually want this class. Instead, I believe we just want to use the separate `ContinuousMapClass F A B` and `AlgHomClass F R A B`. This isn't a problem because these are `Prop`-valued classes now that `FunLike` has been unbundled from the hom-class hierarchy. If you disagree, please continue the discussion here: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/ContinuousMonoidHomClass.20etc/near/451600499
Done.

This creates two non-defeq coercions from `A →A[R] B` to `A →ₐ[R] B`. There's this one, that you're adding, but with the instance `continuousAlgHomClass` below (which we should definitely have), we get the one passing through `AlgHomClass`, namely [AlgHomClass.toAlgHom](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Hom.html#AlgHomClass.toAlgHom) via [AlgHomClass.coeTC](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Hom.html#AlgHomClass.coeTC). We have a preference for the latter, so please delete this one; this may require some re-jiggering of your code below.
Done.
You should just inline this into the `funLike` instance below.
done

```suggestion
instance : FunLike (A →A[R] B) A B where
```
We have a nice naming algorithm for instances now, so unless you have a special reason to name an instance (i.e., to reference it in another declaration, I would suggest not naming them).

idem
```suggestion
instance :
```

I *think* you can mark this `simp` too, unless I'm missing something.
```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem coe_mk (f : A →ₐ[R] B) (h) : (mk f h : A →ₐ[R] B) = f := rfl
```

This will be the default soon, and hopefully we can delete `continuity`. If you still need the `continuity` tag for now, that's fine, just include both in that case.
```suggestion
@[fun_prop]
```
Also, it shouldn't actually be necessary, as it should just follow from the `ContinuousMapClass` instance, but I think having the explicit lemma does help `fun_prop`'s performance.

The `..` syntax is a nice new feature in Lean 4. Also, stylistically, I think unless everything fits on one line, we generally prefer to have a new line for the body of the declaration (I realize this is not mentioned in the style guide, but I think it is relatively uniform across the library).
```suggestion
    f (c • x) = c • f x :=
  map_smul ..
```
Why are you adding a deprecated lemma? Also, the date is wrong. Let's just exclude it entirely.
Can you move this lemma much earlier, maybe around `coe_mk'`?
Please add a docstring here.

At the very least this should either be unnamed or `protected`, but I think the former makes more sense.
```suggestion
instance : One (A →A[R] A) := ⟨id R A⟩
```

```suggestion
def protected id : A →A[R] A := ⟨AlgHom.id R A, continuous_id⟩
```

```suggestion
instance : Mul (A →A[R] A) := ⟨comp⟩
```

It's not a `MonoidWithZero` anyway
```suggestion
instance : Monoid (A →A[R] A) where
```

Here you want to use the coercion available from the `AlgHomClass` instance. Again, the idea is to uniformize everything on a single spelling, which makes it easier on your future self. Note that the docstring will also need to change.
```suggestion
  toFun        := (↑)
```
You should add a `@[simp]` lemma here that `f.toAlgHom = f`, where `f : A →A[R] B`, to ensure that you focus on the correct spelling.

optional and untested, I just wanted to let you know this spelling exists:
```suggestion
  isClosed_eq (map_continuous f) (map_continuous g) |>.completeSpace_coe
```
This shouldn't be a `Porting note`. Does it even still apply? If so, let's just remove this note.
I think this belongs in `Topology.Algebra.MulAction`

Yes, but some more work is needed to have it inserted there.
(And probably it can be generalized to the context of Topology.Algebra.MulAction)
I tried to put it there, put that requires to add an import (Algebra) to this file, plus inclusion of other lemmas because `ContinuousSMul` follows from the continuity of `algebraMap`.
Is this not just `by simp`? or `by simp [commutes]`? That would be more readable unless it's much slower.

```suggestion
topological (semi-)rings which are continuous. The set of continuous algebra homomorphisms between
```
Can you add a "TODO: replace with `fun_prop` when that is stable"

unless I'm misreading, this should be the name
```suggestion
theorem toAlgHom_eq_coe (f : A →A[R] B) : f.toAlgHom = f := rfl
```

```suggestion
theorem coe_inj {f g : A →A[R] B} : (f : A →ₐ[R] B) = g ↔ f = g :=   by
```

```suggestion
instance : ContinuousMapClass (A →A[R] B) A B where
```
please add a docstring here.
Is there a reason not to use `Algebra.adjoin` instead of `Submodule.span`? That seems the more natural result here.
Again, why do we prefer `Submodule` to `Subalgebra` here?
and here.
Why not `AlgHom.eqLocus`?
because it does not exist…
Do you believe I should add it (that is, the equivalent for `Subalgebra` of the file  `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.Submodule.EqLocus`?)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Algebra/Algebra): add ContinuousAlgHom
